Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Loudly \Loud"ly\, adv. In a loud manner. --Denham. [1913 Webster]

loudly adv 1: with relatively high volume; "the band played loudly"; "she spoke loudly and angrily"; "he spoke loud enough for those at the back of the room to hear him"; "cried aloud for help" [syn: {loud}, {aloud}] [ant: {softly}] 2: in manner that attracts attention; "obstreperously, he demanded to get service" [syn: {obstreperously}, {clamorously}] 3: used as a direction in music; to be played relatively loudly [syn: {forte}] [ant: {piano}]
